intro: Hieracium listrium, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped, with yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium listrium is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
